text: Hi everyone, today I’m introducing you to a seafood dish called Cua Rang Me.
Before we begin, let me introduce a friend…
Hi Helen, hi everyone. I’m Ngoc Thao.
Thao, please let us know why you are here.
I would like to invite you to join the Ariel’s Challenge
that guarantees to remove 100 stains in one wash.
Ok, now let’s start!
I have bought here a crab that is still alive
Deep-fry the crabs for 2 minutes
When the crab turns orange red, remove and drain off the excess oil
Now let’s make the sauce
To the ratio of 1:2:3:4
1  tablespoon oyster sauce
Can I try it?
Go ahead
Then we will use it… to make a stain
OMG
What is it, sis?
That’s palm sugar.
You can use brown sugar, too, but palm sugar is tastier.
Make it 2 tablespoons
3 tbsp fish sauce
4 tbsp tamarind liquid
Simmer 1 to 2 minutes till thickened
Toss the crab with the sauce for 5 minutes
Yeah! Yummy!
Now let’s plate!
We have finished making Tamarind crab
and tried it in front of you, so yummy!
But the consequence is horrible
My shirt is fully stained.
No problem at all. I will use Ariel to wash it for you!
Hey Helen, this is your shirt
I have washed it clean. Here you are!
Wow, I did not expect it to be this clean!
But I think those mud stains caused by the gentlemen when playing sports is more difficult to clean.
So Helen and I decided to invite Nhan Phuc Vinh to take up this challenge.
Now it’s time to say goodbye!
